intro: Deinbollia fulvotomentella, commonly known as the hairy leaf vine, is a climbing plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its hairy, ovate leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces capsule fruits that contain numerous small, dry seeds. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural studies.
